title: 2019-01-17 - Sliver Implant Framework
plain_text:
# Sliver

**github.com/BishopFox/sliver**

BishopFox

Sliver is an open source cross-platform adversary emulation/red team framework, it can be
used by organizations of all sizes to perform security testing. Sliver's implants support C2
over Mutual TLS (mTLS), WireGuard, HTTP(S), and DNS and are dynamically compiled with
per-binary asymmetric encryption keys.

The server and client support MacOS, Windows, and Linux. Implants are supported on
MacOS, Windows, and Linux (and possibly every Golang compiler target but we've not
tested them all).

GoGo passingpassing [go reportgo report A+A+](https://goreportcard.com/report/github.com/BishopFox/sliver) [LicenseLicense GPLv3GPLv3](https://www.gnu.org/licenses/gpl-3.0)

## Features

Dynamic code generation
Compile-time obfuscation
Multiplayer-mode
Staged and Stageless payloads
[Procedurally generated C2 over HTTP(S)](https://github.com/BishopFox/sliver/wiki/HTTP(S)-C2#under-the-hood)
[DNS canary blue team detection](https://github.com/BishopFox/sliver/wiki/DNS-C2#dns-canaries)
[Secure C2 over mTLS, WireGuard, HTTP(S), and DNS](https://github.com/BishopFox/sliver/wiki/Transport-Encryption)
[Fully scriptable using JavaScript/TypeScript or](https://github.com/moloch--/sliver-script) [Python](https://github.com/moloch--/sliver-py)
Windows process migration, process injection, user token manipulation, etc.


[go reportgo report A+A+](https://goreportcard.com/report/github.com/BishopFox/sliver)


GoGo


-----

Let s Encrypt integration
In-memory .NET assembly execution
COFF/BOF in-memory loader
TCP and named pipe pivots
Much more!

## Getting Started

[Download the latest release and see the Sliver wiki for a quick tutorial on basic setup and](https://github.com/BishopFox/sliver/releases)
usage. To get the very latest and greatest compile from source.

**Linux One Liner**
```
curl https://sliver.sh/install|sudo bash and then run sliver

## Help!

```
[Please checkout the wiki, or start a](https://github.com/BishopFox/sliver/wiki) [GitHub discussion. We also tend to hang out in the](https://github.com/BishopFox/sliver/discussions)
[#golang Slack channel on the Bloodhound Gang server.](https://bloodhoundgang.herokuapp.com/)
